definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to sacrifice one's wealth to save the state (idiom)
Lin Shu (1852-1924), writer and influential translator and adaptor of vast swathes of Western literature into Classical Chinese
to provide financial relief/to bail out (financially)/financial relief/bailout
to relieve/to ease (pressure)/to alleviate/to remove/to get rid of

sentences.english: The company needed an emergency $500-million bank bailout.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司需要银行五亿元的紧急纾困。

sentences.english: It soothed my black hole in the heart and in the stomach.
sentences.chinese: 它让我心脏和胃部的黑洞得到纾缓。

sentences.english: The added moisture helps relieve the dryness often associated with respiratory problems.
sentences.chinese: 喝这些茶有助于纾缓因呼吸困难等引起的干燥。

sentences.english: You might also wonder where the bail-out money would come from.
sentences.chinese: 你可能还想知道纾困资金的来源。

sentences.english: A sight glass provides ease in checking oil level.
sentences.chinese: 一视镜提供纾缓在检查油的水平。

sentences.english: In two or three more days, I noticed the pain was very much diminished.
sentences.chinese: 再经过两三天，我感觉疼动已大幅纾缓。

sentences.english: However, the government has ample room to ease policy.
sentences.chinese: 不过，政府有足够的政策空间来纾缓。

sentences.english: Open it occasionally to relieve the pressure.
The bailout plan is dressed up as an American solution to financial crises.
sentences.chinese: 这金援纾困计划被包装为美式处理财务危机之道。

sentences.english: This includes pain control and , in some cases, relief of muscle spasm.
sentences.chinese: 这包括疼痛控制和，在某些情况下，纾缓肌肉痉挛。

sentences.english: In the case of severe heartburn one may not be enough to bring relief.
sentences.chinese: 在案件严重胃灼热的一个可能仍不足以纾缓。

sentences.english: Yoga is a popular stress- buster in the Indonesian capital of Jakarta.
sentences.chinese: 瑜伽在印尼首都雅加达是广受欢迎的纾压方法。

sentences.english: I see a lot of love working in palliative care.
sentences.chinese: 在纾缓治疗工作中见到很多爱。

definition: (archaic) to give birth to a child/to rear
to deepen (e.g. a ditch)/to extract/to manage/ladle (old)
to wash/to rinse/any of three 10-day division of the month (during Tang dynasty)/Taiwan pr. [huan3]/also pr. [wan3]
